channel.title: Auto Color?
channel.description: I just want to know how people make auto color scripts... not using bitmaps and dtms

item.title: Auto Color?
item.dc:creator: @yohojo yohojo
item.description:
@yohojo wrote:

if ur making autoclor for non falt times (3d objeets in gamescreen) i do things like this
hers an example for geting zombie color in one of my scripts
X:=13//Specifies where the color spiral starts
Y:=40
repeat
If Findcolorspiraltolerance(x,y,REFCOLOR,1,1,500,700,10)then//looks for color
MMouse(x,y,2,2)//Moves Mouse
X:=X+30//changes spiral starting point so it searches from a diferetn spot
Y:=Y+30
Tries:=Tries+1
until
IsUptest(‘ombie’) or
(Tries=6)
If IsUptest(‘ombie’) then
begin
ZombieColor:=(Getcolor(x,y))
HOORAY

that works all the time for me =)

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Color?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

tonekray:

Oh ok. But is there anyway to find the color by text up in the upper right corner?

Yes, use SRL. Then have the color searches, and if there IsUpTextMulti(‘Audbury’,‘dbur’,‘de Audb’) then GetColor(x,y). Or something like that…

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Color?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Most people would just use ColorFinding with a tolerance for something like that. Or you could have the script check for a color, if its there, check for another color around it in a specific box. That would work better, but be sure to use tolerances.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Color?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Not using Bitmaps, or DTMS making autocolor can be tough, and Not-reliant. You can use color searches with tolerances. Are you trying to find something on the Bitmap, or Main screen?
